sub_title: Assistant Professor in Organizational Behavior & Research Methods; Co-founder & Board Member of the Scilink Foundation
summary: Stefan T. Mol is an assistant professor in Organizational Behavior and Research Methods at the Amsterdam Business School of the University of Amsterdam and co-founder and chair of the Scilink foundation. He received his Master's degree in psychology at the University of Amsterdam in 2000, and his PhD in psychology in 2007, at the Institute of Psychology of the Erasmus University Rotterdam. Stefan has co-authored over 25 peer-reviewed articles and book chapters on topics such as career shocks, refugee integration, learning analytics, text mining, recommendation of open educational resources, person-environment fit, and researcher mental health. In addition, Stefan is involved in a number of EU funded projects focused on optimizing the match between individual education and the labor market and researcher mental health.

projects.title: European Journal of Work and Organizational Psychology Special Issue: Experiencing Fit and Misfit: Process Views, Dynamic Interactions, and Temporal Considerations
projects.description: In this special issue, we want to publish papers that explore the complexity and dynamic nature of fit and misfit both from theoretical and empirical perspectives. Empirically, we are open to both quantitative and qualitative studies. Quantitative studies must be longitudinal, multi-source, multi-method, or some combination thereof. Qualitative studies should be rigorous in method, transparent in analysis, and provide theoretical implications. We welcome innovative research methods and designs. Neither quantitative nor qualitative studies should employ samples based on students. Please see http://explore.tandfonline.com/cfp/beh/pewo-si-experiencing-fit-and-misfit for more detailed information.

projects.title: Eduworks
projects.description:
The objective of EDUWORKS is to train talented early-stage researchers in the socio-economic and psychological dynamics of the labour supply and demand matching processes at aggregated and disaggregated levels. EDUWORKS brings together researchers from several academic disciplines. namely: Labour Economics, Sociology of Occupations, HRM, Lifelong Learning. Increasing segments of the demand side and the supply side of the labour market are digitized, ranging from job sites and cv’s at Facebook and Linkedin to extensive databases with job descriptions and related skills demands. These developments have led to Knowledge Management and educational challenges in these matching processes. Specifically, EDUWORKS will focus on matching processes at three levels and on one overarching topic:

-Individual level fit between job demands - persons’ abilities
-Meso-level employers’ demands for occupational skills versus occupational dynamics
-European and national level labour supply and demand matches and mismatches 
-Knowledge Management for supply and demand matches

projects.title: OntoTech
projects.description: The OntoTechnology approach believes in utilizing job knowledge as a predictor of future job performance. Job knowledge, as opposed to disposition, has the major advantage of being malleable, thus allowing a person a centered approach to personnel selection. The main aims and objectives of this project are to provide detailed personalized assessment and training of essential technical competencies and related job knowledge elements that are required for a certain position. Characteristics of the consortium: Center of Jobknowledge Research (University of Amsterdam), CVO Antwerpen, NetpositiveLtd.. A general description of outcomes includes: – a customizable, adaptive job knowledge test – a general mental ability test – an applicant ranking based on integrated job knowledge and GMA test performance – an automatic and tailored e-Learning content delivery on the basis of test results – a cutting-edge semantic technology for job knowledge structuring, testing and evaluation.

projects.title: MED-ASSESS
projects.description:
A consortium consisting of the Institute of Knowledge Based Systems and Knowledge Management of the University of Siegen (Siegen, Germany), Beta Klinik GmbH (Bonn, Germany), Corvinno Technology Transfer Center (Budapest, Hungary), and the HRM-OB group of the Amsterdam Business School, has been granted a Leonardo da Vinci Transfer of Innovation Project by the German National Agency for European Education at the Federal Institute for Vocational Training (under the auspices of the Lifelong Learning Program of the EU). 

The proposed work entitled “Adaptive Medical Profession Assessor” (Acronym: Med-Assess) received 94 out of a maximum of 115 points and involves a total project revenue of nearly 400.000 euro. The project, which will last for a period of two years, will be kicked off in October 2012, and will pick up where the successfully completed OntoHR project (www.ontohr.eu), in which Corvinno and the ABS were previously involved, left off. 

Specifically, the Med-Assess project is aimed at facilitating employee selection and individual training needs analysis through the detailed assessment of that job-knowledge that is required for successful performance in specific jobs in healthcare support. Applicants or employees will complete a computerized adaptive knowledge test that will culminate in a comprehensive knowledge profile that may, depending on the requirements of the user, be complemented with an individually tailored training needs analysis. The former may assist HR professional in selection decision making, whereas the latter will be linked to digitized training content and specific courses on offer at institutes of higher vocational education. Whereas OntoHR was focused on the ICT Systems Analyst job role, Med-Assess will be targeting several jobs from the healthcare support job family.

projects.title: OntoHR
projects.description:
OntoHR is a personnel selection and training platform that takes an individualized approach to the assessment and development of job knowledge.
On the basis of cutting edge semantic technology, OntoHR provides detailed personalized assessment and training of essential technical competencies and related job knowledge elements that are required for a certain position.

Teaching and Learning in Higher Education

profile_positions.description:
Teaching courses on research methods, academic writing, human resource management, social entrepreneurship (BSc/Premaster), research/survey design, quantitative data analysis, human resource management, performance management/organizational behavior, cross-cultural management (Master) ethics in business research (Research Master). Supervision of 62 MSc theses, and 31 BSc theses (completed).

Conducting research on expatriate selection, psychological contracts, e-recruitment, proactivity, job crafting, text-mining, employability, career shocks, refugee adaption, and job knowledge as a selection context predictor of job performance.

Member of the Programme Commitee Business Administration, the ICT & Education Program Council, Coordinator of the UvA Learning Analytics Program, Member of the Board of Management of the EU Marie Curie Initial Training Network Eduworks (2013-2017)
profile_positions.title: Assistant Professor in Organizational Behavior and Research Methods

profile_positions.description: The nature of researchers’ work in the 21st century is changing rapidly! In academia and the corporate sector, researchers need to be confident, capable communicators; experts in research management, aware of the diversity of intercultural research groups and disciplines, manage stressful steps in their research, but remain open and innovative at the same time. At Scilink we are committed to providing education to early stage and experienced researchers, which reflects these needs. Building on the Eduworks-Network, we deliver high quality workshops for groups of researchers active in diverse and interdisciplinary environments.
profile_positions.title: Board member and cofounder

profile_positions.description: Conducting three studies centered around the topic of expatriate selection, and a fourth study on predicting the training performance of police trainees at the South African Police Services
profile_positions.title: PhD Candidate

profile_positions.description: Member of a project team working on the development of the intercultural effectiveness (ICE) training.
profile_positions.title: Researcher
